page.title: 02LANDSCAPE
page.content: Deopham village is situated on the top of a 200 feet ridge that slopes to the North. The land then rises again to the Watton -Norwich road.Lying in the valley bottom is the small hamlet of Hackford. Wicklewood is on the north facing slope of the ridge and extends over the ridge to the parishes of Morley Saint Peter and Morley Saint Botolph. In Wicklewood at the bottom of the north facing slope is a small stream which, eventually, joins the Yare river system.This river flows into the sea at Yarmouth. Rivers to the south of the areaflow into the Ouse river system entering the sea near Kings Lynn.The ridge is a watershed between the two river systems.
